text: oh this bill cunningham stepping back
into the roaring 1920s when the
speakeasies flourished and women raised
the hemlines on their dresses then they
flappers with their headbands and their
feather bores it was a time of total
breaking away from the rigid
restrictions of the earlier Victorian
and Edwardian errors and for the last
eight summers the governor's island
group had invited the vintage dance
musician Michael Allen and his dream
line band to recreate that fabulous
period of the roaring 20s on Governors
Island last weekend on both Saturday and
Sunday there were four thousand guests
each day they paid thirty dollars to get
inside a fenced-in parade ground where
they were blanket to blanket it looked
like Coney Island on the fourth of July
but it gained enormous charm by all the
young people that come there and do
their interpretation of a 1920s look and
it really is delightful to see the
teenage kids getting themselves done up
in lipstick and headbands and I mean no
wasted dresses if it it's wonderful the
influence of the 20s the flapper has
always been a favorite with many people
the fashion world in particular and here
are women in going to society parties
this past winter and spring in dresses
newly made the black and gold beaded
dresses of Gucci it's everywhere I mean
sometimes subtle sometimes a little more
costumey with the headbands but people
are just enjoying it
it's all the fantasy today's cookie
cutter life has been sanitized up so the
kids can come out and everyone said oh
yes they're playing dress-up costume
well it's now it's just when you see the
young young people out there it's the
spirit oath it just is the very same
spirit of freedom that broke all the
rules from the past in the 1920s
